meanings.definition: To strike or push with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The goat was butting its head against the fence.
meanings.sent2: The ram enjoys butting heads with other rams during mating season.
meanings.sent3: The playful calf kept butting the farmer's leg for attention.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were butting against the horizon, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: The boxer practiced butting the punching bag to improve his technique.

meanings.sent1: The nosy neighbor was always butting into other people's business.
meanings.sent2: Please don't butt in while I'm having a private conversation.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat couldn't resist butting into the room to investigate.
meanings.sent4: The unwanted guest kept butting into the ongoing discussion, disrupting the flow.
meanings.sent5: The loud music from the party was butting into the peaceful atmosphere of the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a phrase or clause contrasting with what has already been mentioned.
meanings.sent1: I wanted to go for a walk, butting the rain started pouring down.
meanings.sent2: She claimed to be an expert, butting her knowledge was limited to basic concepts.
meanings.sent3: He said he was on a diet, butting he couldn't resist the temptation of the cake.
meanings.sent4: The movie was advertised as a comedy, butting it turned out to be a drama.
meanings.sent5: The store promised quick delivery, butting the package arrived a week late.
